messages.content: which is the primary purpose of it.
i like how 90% of all downfall players think slimeboss is a fine and balanced character because its downfall, THE official expansion
It's literally frontloaded potency at the cost of slimes being harder to use after a few turns.
biased cognition takes 6 turns to start being bad
and it doesn't permanently remove your orbs in three turns
and even if it did
you can just make new orbs of the type you want
you can't just print three leeching slimes the turn they get absorbed
Yes overexert is worse than biased cognition, like a top 5 defect card (character that relied super heavily on orbs)
I'm just saying it's not a very good card comparatively
it's also bait since slime builds (lol) only want 3 split cards (four with banner)
Yes that is true, and I don't think anyone was saying otherwise
like, you want x3 leeching duplicated form pile on with potency and that gives you like 60 block after eight kabillion turns of set up
I think overexert works best with thinner decks with basic split and glop chop spam. I'm not saying this is a great way to play the character, just the best way to use overexert's strengths.
glop chop is just a wacky card
Glop chop has a similar feeling as dead branch to me. Sacrifice consistency for just good value. Not as good as dead branch, but a similar idea.
You can't consistently control your first slime with it, but it's pretty alright damage with the slime as well.

Like i cant click on this card and know even remotely what its going to do, even if i know what slimes it can spawn
Pair with the random "slimes exhaust" nonsense and this is probably in the bottom 5-10 cards in the whole mod design wise

Luckily strategies that involve you keeping one specific slime in front and command spamming them are really just not easily obtainable, as you need a lot of potency, command, and a way to put the right slime in the right spot.
does <mass repurpose> still exist?

embeds.title: Repurpose
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

**Absorb** - Split into a random **Specialist.**
 **Command.)**
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: But we dont then need two more of them
Glop chop could pick a specialist, mass repurpose could just be a different card entirely
And this card is just underpowered
I mean in the sense of "fear of potentially creating a press e to end turn"
Defect frost deck:
Defect is already a really slow character who needs proper set up
slime boss requires the same set up but harder with less payoff
which is why you should build lick recursion 99% of the time and just ignore slimes.
Yeah, its either spam lick of spam command on one slime
that is the thing michael feared when creating slimes
Mass splitting simply isnt viable, even on A0, the cards just run out
and so he went too far in the opposite direction
and thus the "reprogram equivalent" ends up being the build most people use
and the issue with having just one slime is that you draw all of your required powers that do nothing first and then the slime itself is on the bottom of the deck.
Yeah it really is bottle or nothing
(Or just draft many copies of such slime, if you can get them)
No as someone who's played a lot of low ascension slime, it definitely is viable on low ascension.
But that's not saying much, a lot of things are viable on low ascension.

It's a rough design, but I don't totally hate it. I just think that specialist slimes as a whole need a bit of clarification/redesign. With 8 possible wildly different results, and no agency as to which you will get, you just can't really play around them tactically. It would be one thing if they were all more powerful than the best regular slimes (leeching), but many of them are worse by a wide margin. I think the better change would be to let the player pick from 3 options among the 8, so you at least have some control over the end effect. If specialist slimes are meant to be a reward, then they need to feel good, and you need to have some control over which ones you're making. Having each one have it's own role that it can really fulfill well to give them a toolbox approach could be really nice(Compile package for example has many options that are useful in short/medium/long fights). That way you can make an informed choice tailored to the fight that you're in.

As for this card specifically, the absorb makes it even more situational. Not only do you have no idea what it will do when you draft/play it, but you can also brick with it. Sure, it's 0 cost, but there's a very real chance that you even if you can play it, you end up with weaker board presence (even considering the +1 strength, since slime boss has very few payoffs for that). The upgrade is also very lackluster, especially on a card that is single use, since you have no idea how helpful the immediate frontload of the command will be. Maybe if you had dead branch, ink bottle, letter opener, and strange spoon, you could consider drafting this for the 0 cost aspect and the relic value, but outside of that, I see little reason to gamble on taking the current version of repurpose. Slime summoning as a whole feels fairly lackluster right now, and could use some attention.
I think that the only slime that occupies a truly interesting design space is cultist slime, since it scales both with command and potency.
Time Slime and Insulting Slime and just weird and both command and potency turn their effects into total overkill.

Ghostflame Slime is just not good? It scales damage twice with potency but Soulburn is just delayed damage and it's not like you have anything to synergize with the Soulburn because you're slime boss and not Hexaghost.
time slime being weak is weird, weak is definitely not the first thing I think of when thinking about time eater (the first thing I think of is intense anger)

Thorns Slime is also another "wacky" effect since you don't have debuff reduction, but it scales well with command rather than potency. Good Teamwork contender, if it wasn't completely random to get it.
Torchhead slime is just in a weird design space, especially since the main method of getting Potency is Liquidate, which lowers Strength.
I mean, why, for what purpose.
A redesign of Torch Head slimes design to be more in line with a collector mechanic would be good.
Ancient Slime would be run definingly good if A: Other slimes were good and B: It wasn't literally random.

Yeah, I think the cleanest way forward I can see is to make them into toolbox choices where you get to pick 1 of 3 randomly chosen. Retool them a bit to make meaningful choices like with compile package. The ghostflame one probably stands out right now as the weakest, since it is just delayed damage, which feels worse than even the basic slimes. Torchhead definitely could be moved more into line with current collector (maybe he can give you reserves? or apply affliction). Ancient slime would probably be too strong in it's current iteration if you got to pick between 3, but maybe it could be draw next turn instead.
bronze slime is super garbage as scales horribly with potency and command
lol bronze slime so bad I forgor about it completely lol
